title.narrative: Partners for Resilience Ethiopia

description.narrative: Integrated Risk Management to build community resilience in Ethiopia

Partners for Resilience Program 2011-2015 supported partners in Ethiopia to implement long- and short-term measures to reduce disaster risks. In PfR Program 2016-2020 stakeholders aim to strengthen their policy dialogue capacity in Integrated Risk Management (IRM) with the relevant Ministries of Ethiopia. This way they can contribute to improved policies for IRM, IRM proof investment and implementation of IRM practices, which will promote a sustained application of IRM and can contribute to national and international agreements.

The target groups of the PfR II program differ per thematic domain. The program directly targets Disaster Risk Management Commission / Coordination Offices at various levels, Government bodies and Ministries at various levels/themes, River Basin Authorities, Bureau of Agriculture, Meteorological Office, Civil Society Organizations and private sector. Indirect beneficiaries are all farmers, pastoralists, communities, local industries & companies, and wildlife authorities in hazard prone areas
